analysis_general: The job posting subtly discriminates against individuals based on their socio-economic status, educational background, and criminal history. The language used reflects a negative polarity, with phrases such as "degree from a reputable vocational school preferred" and "do not consider applicants with criminal records," which may discourage certain groups from applying. The posting also lacks transparency in its initial requirements, such as the emphasis on "reputable" institutions and the exclusion of apprenticeships as relevant experience.
text:
Company: Cordova Group
Role: Tool Grinder

About Us:
Cordova Group is a leading manufacturing company specializing in precision tools and equipment. We pride ourselves on our commitment to excellence and our reputation for delivering high-quality products.

Job Description:
We are seeking a skilled Tool Grinder to join our team. As a Tool Grinder, you will be responsible for grinding and sharpening cutting tools to precise specifications. The ideal candidate will have a strong attention to detail and the ability to work well in a fast-paced environment.

Responsibilities:

 Grind and sharpen cutting tools to precise specifications
 Inspect tools for defects and damage
 Collaborate with other team members to meet production deadlines
 Maintain a clean and organized workspace

Qualifications and Experience:

 2+ years of experience in a similar role (apprenticeships not considered)
 High school diploma or equivalent required; degree from a reputable vocational school preferred
 Ability to pass a background check (Please note that we do not consider applicants with criminal records)

Perks and Benefits:

 We are committed to fair and equitable pay practices. The salary for this position ranges from $45,000 to $60,000 USD, based on your experience and skills.
 Opportunities for advancement and professional development
 Comprehensive health and dental benefits
